Judul: DEVELOPMENT OF MANUAL FOR SAIL-FLIGHT TEST PROGRAM OF WING-IN-SURFACE EFFECT CRAFT (Case Study: WiSE-8 W1)
Abstrak:
Flight test of an aircraft is a process fundamental to the development and advancement of
aeronautical knowledge in order to validate the operation and the systems on an aircraft,
also to provide data for the Operation Flight Manual. Sea trial of a ship is full scale trials to
determine ship maneuvering characteristics and maneuverability as a reaction to water
rudder and engine actions.
The requirements are implemented for Wing-in-Surface Effect (WiSE) craft, a surface effect
vehicle, for which undergo flight phase on its operation and also experience on-water
maneuver then clustered in Sail-Flight Test Program. The various activities and aspects of
Sail-Flight Test Engineering must be considered when planning, conducting, and reporting
the test program. In conducting such activities, test manual is an absolute necessity to
guide the program and provide adequate database template to record the data.
This thesis describes various subjects of sail-flight tests that are conducted during the
development of a newly developed wing-in-surface effect craft. Pre-Sail-Flight Tests are
activities done simultaneously with design and engineering of the craft, followed by
Ground Test as preparation phase to ensure that the craft fulfill the condition required for
Sea Trial and Flight Test. Sea Trial consists of on-water maneuvering test, while Flight Test
involving flight maneuvers of a wing-in-surface effect craft. Each Section offers a brief
introduction to the topic under consideration, the nature and the objectives of the tests to
be conducted. It also discusses the test instrumentation required, describes the test
maneuvers and techniques to be executed, and indicates the way in which the test
parameters is selected, analyzed, and presented. Items to be discussed involving:
evaluation of test data to be compared with predicted data and the activities that must
take place upon completion of the test program.
At present, there is no known particular manual developed yet for Wing in Surface Effect
craft, especially in Indonesia, which accommodate its specific characteristic. This research
will focus on developing a comprehensive sail-flight test manual to be used as a general
guideline to carry out the sail-flight test program. This thesis will provide complete
information for the engineer to get them familiarize with sea trial as well as flight test
techniques, a perspective or framework which assess the wing in surface effect test
program and put together an executable plan to achieve those goals.
Kata Kunci: sail-flight test manual, wing in surface effect craft, sail-flight test technique
